item.title: Useful commands I use
item.description: A list of commands that I like to use

item.title: Don't use 'git commit -m'
item.description: Commit messages should be detailed and carefully written. Take your time.

item.title: Synchronization and Syntonization
item.description: Aligning and keeping clocks aligned

item.title: Wiretime
item.description: Measure the time a packet is on the wire accurately using hardware timestamping. Useful for measuring the impact of traffic congestion and QoS.

item.title: Hexend
item.description: Send hexdumps copied from Tcpdump/Wireshark. Easily repeat and manually modify useful or problematic frames instead of relying on pcap playback.

item.title: Capmon
item.description: A Linux capabilities(7) monitor. Monitor capability checks to find what a command requires. Then give yourself those capabilities to run without sudo.

item.title: PTP and timestamping methods
item.description: A maybe not so gentle introduction to the Precision Time Protocol

item.title: Jekyll markdown lists that don't start on 1.
item.description: Custom properties of specific elements in a post

item.title: Hexend - Send raw hex frames
item.description: A tool I made for sending raw hex frames

item.title: The day Make started crashing
item.description: The last thing you want is for your build system to crash

item.title: A simpler life without sudo
item.description: Using Capmon to figure out what capabilities your program needs

item.title: TSN: Time-Aware Shaper
item.description: Time Sensitive Networking and the 802.1Qbv standard

item.title: What is Time-Sensitive Networking?
item.description: An introduction to Time-Sensitive Networking and some of its techniques

item.title: Network bridge forwarding and learning
item.description: Bridge forwarding of unicast and multicast in software and hardware

item.title: Nondeterministic functions
item.description: Types of nondeterminism and interesting ways of handling them.

item.title: Bouncing balls simulation using X11
item.description: A small project where I explore the X11 API in C.

item.title: Functions: a deep dive
item.description: Programming functions from a mathematical perspective.

item.title: Cellular automata
item.description: Conway's Game of Life and other cellular automata. Originally a school essay.

item.title: Programming: how to learn it and how to get help.
item.description: A tutorial for how to use tutorials. Some tips on how to learn efficiently.

item.title: Type inference with Hindley-Milner W algorithm
item.description: A demonstration of the Hindley-Milner W Algorithm in F#.

item.title: Operators are functions too
item.description: Viewing operators as functions and functions as operators.

item.title: Static vs dynamic typing
item.description: Comparing static and dynamic typing and my experiences and opinions.

item.title: About Me
item.description: My name is Casper Andersson and I currently work as a software developer. I enjoy most types of non-UI programming. I am absolutely trash at doing pretty user interfaces and prefer my programs to stay within the terminal. Due to my job my interests currently lie in C programming and computer networks. On top of programming I also really like to write technical blogposts and documentation. Experience Working with embedded Linux systems on network switches.
